thread.title: £468m plans to solve Operation Stack chaos | Meridian
thread.title_full: £468m plans to solve Operation Stack chaos | Meridian - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: £468m plans to solve Operation Stack chaos | Meridian
text:
Operation Stack has caused traffic chaos for lorry drivers, holidaymakers and much of Kent for 32 days this year.
It turns the M20 into a lorry park when the route across the channel is blocked.
So Highways England and Kent County Council have come up with plans to reduce the impact of Stack - costing £468million pounds.
But Cllr Matthew Balfour, Cabinet Member for Environment and Transport at Kent County Council, says the council won't be paying.
Play video The money would pay for a lorry park for 4,000 HGVs close to the M20, extending the existing STOP24 lorry park and improvement work on the M20 and A20.
You can watch a full report by Abigail Bracken below.
Play video Last updated Tue 15 Sep 2015 World Kent dover
